decks.notes: This Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of cards that provide value through card advantage, removal, and graveyard interactions. The deck aims to control the game by disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also generating value and card advantage through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy. The deck also has a toolbox approach with cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald to find answers to different situations. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through control and resource management.

The main focus of this Dimir Inverter deck is to utilize the powerful combo of Thassa's Oracle and Inverter of Truth to win the game by putting your entire library into your graveyard and then ensuring you have no cards left in your library when Thassa's Oracle enters the battlefield, leading to a victory. The deck includes various control elements like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's strategy, as well as card draw and selection spells like Dig Through Time and Opt to help you find and assemble your combo pieces efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Lotus Field in order to generate a large amount of mana quickly. By using cards like Fae of Wishes, Vizier of Tumbling Sands, and Hidden Strings to untap Lotus Field and Strategic Planning and Pore Over the Pages to find more combo pieces, the deck aims to set up a winning combination quickly. Thassa's Oracle serves as a win condition, allowing the player to win the game by revealing their entire library. The deck also includes disruption cards like Blink of an Eye and Dig Through Time to control the game until the combo can be assembled.

This deck focuses on using a variety of removal spells, hand disruption, and versatile planeswalkers to control the game until Niv-Mizzet Reborn hits the battlefield. The deck includes cards like Thoughtseize, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Bring to Light to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping into powerful threats like Niv-Mizzet Reborn and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The mana base is designed to support Niv-Mizzet's color requirements and ensure smooth mana development throughout the game. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until victory.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a fast and aggressive creature strategy focusing on Spirits. By utilizing cards that provide efficient creature utility and evasion, the deck aims to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with counter spells like Spell Queller and tempo plays like Brazen Borrower. The deck also takes advantage of powerful tribal synergies and the ability to generate card advantage through cards like Collected Company.

The focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with aggressive spirit creatures and utilize Collected Company to efficiently bring them onto the battlefield. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of flying creatures boosted by tribal synergies, such as Supreme Phantom and Empyrean Eagle. Additionally, protection and disruption elements like Rattlechains and Spell Queller are included to maintain control of the game and protect key creatures. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive strategy and ensure consistency in casting its spells.

The main focus of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent by playing efficient one-drop creatures like Bloodsoaked Champion and Gutterbones, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The aggressive strategy is further enhanced by powerful finishers like Spawn of Mayhem and Rankle, Master of Pranks. The deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total while maintaining a steady board presence through recursion and card advantage provided by cards like Castle Locthwain and Mutavault.

The main objective of this Aggro Red Deck Wins Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly overwhelm and deal damage to the opponent by utilizing high-powered creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on aggressive, low-cost creatures such as Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, backed up by powerful burn spells like Lightning Strike and Wild Slash. Cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Goblin Chainwhirler provide additional damage and board control. The deck aims to maintain pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo between Thassa's Oracle and Inverter of Truth to win the game by either decking out the opponent or creating a game state where they have no cards left in their library. The deck includes a variety of ways to control the game, such as counterspells like Drown in the Loch and disruptive spells like Thoughtseize. By manipulating the graveyard and drawing through the deck efficiently with cards like Dig Through Time, the goal is to assemble the combo pieces and secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a board full of powerful Spirit creatures to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. By using cards like Supreme Phantom and Empyrean Eagle to boost the power of the Spirit creatures and cards like Spell Queller and Nebelgast Herald to disrupt the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to maintain a strong presence on the battlefield while disrupting the opponent's strategy. With a mix of flying creatures, counter spells, and protection effects, this deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Thassa's Oracle and Inverter of Truth to win the game. The deck includes cards like Thoughtseize, Dig Through Time, and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries to help find and protect the combo pieces. By milling the entire library with Inverter of Truth and then playing Thassa's Oracle, the player can win the game on the spot. The deck also includes removal spells and counterspells to control the game until the combo can be assembled.

This deck focuses on controlling the board with a mix of powerful planeswalkers, enchantments, and instant spells. The key strategy is to use Fires of Invention to cast spells for free and then use Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck also utilizes Fae of Wishes to search for specific answers in the sideboard. With a mix of removal spells, card draw, and powerful threats like Cavalier of Gales and Kenrith, the Returned King, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent until it can secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. The key strategy is to maintain a constant stream of pressure by using low-cost creatures like Bloodsoaked Champion and Dread Wanderer to chip away at the opponent's life total, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck's high creature density and disruption spells allow it to maintain tempo and pressure throughout the game, leading to a fast and punishing playstyle. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet further adds to the deck's aggressive strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells in order to quickly deplete their life total. This Mono Black Aggro deck utilizes cards like Knight of the Ebon Legion, Rotting Regisaur, and Scrapheap Scrounger to apply pressure early on, while also disrupting the opponent's plans with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck aims to maintain a fast and consistent tempo to take control of the game and secure a victory before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing efficient creatures like Bloodsoaked Champion and Knight of the Ebon Legion to deal quick damage to the opponent. With disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push, the deck aims to control the game while staying ahead on the board. The inclusion of Rankle, Master of Pranks adds versatility and pressure to the strategy, while cards like Castle Locthwain provide card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a fast and aggressive pace to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells in order to quickly deplete their life total and win the game. It focuses on playing efficient and hasty creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Glorybringer, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance. The deck aims to apply constant pressure to the opponent and finish them off with direct damage spells like Lightning Strike and Wild Slash. It also utilizes cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell to increase the damage output of all red sources.

This deck focuses on utilizing green ramp cards like Nissa's Pilgrimage and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to quickly ramp up mana and cast powerful threats such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. Additionally, cards like Satyr Wayfinder and Cavalier of Thorns provide card advantage and help to ensure consistent land drops. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Perilous Vault and finish the game with powerful creatures and planeswalkers, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with its ramp and big threats.

This Sultai Control deck aims to grind out the opponent by controlling the board with removal spells and planeswalkers while generating card advantage through cards like Courser of Kruphix and Satyr Wayfinder. The deck also utilizes powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Emrakul, the Promised End to close out the game. With a mix of creature threats, planeswalker control, and disruption spells, this deck aims to outlast opponents and win through attrition.

This Sultai Control deck aims to maintain board control with a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck focuses on generating value through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Snapcaster Mage, while also utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging its powerful card advantage engines, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in longer games, while also having the potential to close out games with threats like Emrakul, the Promised End.

The deck focuses on using artifacts and aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Ghostfire Blade, Ensoul Artifact, and Shrapnel Blast, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Steel Overseer and Hangarback Walker provide additional support to buff up creatures and create a wide board presence. The deck also includes counterspells like Stubborn Denial for protection. The mana base includes a mix of lands to ensure consistency in casting both artifacts and creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy powerful artifact creatures and enchantments to pressure the opponent and win the game through aggressive combat and direct damage. By utilizing cards like Ghostfire Blade, Ensoul Artifact, and Shrapnel Blast, the deck aims to create strong threats early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Stubborn Denial and Bomat Courier provide additional versatility and card advantage to help secure victory. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy by providing a mix of color sources and utility lands.

The deck focuses on controlling and disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Supreme Verdict, the deck aims to control the board and maintain card advantage with spells like Absorb and Dig Through Time. With a mix of removal spells and versatile counterspells, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win the game through incremental advantage. Additionally, the inclusion of strong planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion provides additional win conditions and ways to close out the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful spirit creatures like Empyrean Eagle and Supreme Phantom to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. It also emphasizes the use of disruptive spells like Spell Queller and Nebelgast Herald to control the board and protect its creatures. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to maintain tempo and Brazen Borrower provides additional versatility. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy while ensuring consistency in casting its spells. This deck aims to consistently apply pressure and quickly close out games against opponents.

This deck aims to quickly manipulate its library, putting Inverter of Truth into play to swap the library with the graveyard and allowing Thassa's Oracle to win the game by having no cards in the library. It uses a combination of card draw, disruption, and removal spells to control the game until it can assemble the combo and secure the win. The deck prioritizes consistency and efficiency in executing its game plan, while also having some flexibility and resilience against opposing strategies.

This deck focuses on utilizing Spirit creatures to quickly put pressure on the opponent and maintain board control. The key strategy involves playing efficient creature spells like Mausoleum Wanderer and Supreme Phantom to boost the power of Spirits, while using disruptive creatures such as Spell Queller and Nebelgast Herald to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Curious Obsession provides card advantage and helps maintain tempo, while Brazen Borrower can provide additional disruption or serve as a threat. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive Spirit tribal strategy.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced aggressive strategy utilizing spirit creatures. By combining cards that boost each other's power and abilities, the deck aims to control the battlefield and deal damage quickly. The inclusion of cards like Collected Company allows for the deck to efficiently pull multiple creatures onto the battlefield at once, increasing the pressure on the opponent. With a mix of evasion, disruption, and synergy, this deck can be a formidable force in a Pioneer 1 vs 1 match.

The main concept of this Aggro - Weenie White deck is to overwhelm the opponent with small but efficient creatures, supported by powerful planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. Heliod, Sun-Crowned acts as both a creature and a mana source, while Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit boosts the team's power. The deck also includes removal spells like Stasis Snare and Elspeth Conquers Death to deal with threats, and resources like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to generate additional mana. The goal is to put pressure on the opponent quickly and efficiently.

The main concept of this Dimir Inverter deck is to manipulate the library and graveyard, using Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by reshuffling the library or having no cards in it. The deck focuses on control elements such as hand disruption and removal spells to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Card draw and selection are key to finding the combo pieces quickly while also controlling the flow of the game. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently by executing the combo before the opponent can establish a strong board presence.

The main idea of this Dimir Inverter combo deck is to manipulate the top cards of the library (through effects like Inverter of Truth and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries) to win the game by either drawing from an empty library or fulfilling a win condition when a certain card is on top. The deck includes a mix of control elements (such as Thoughtseize and Fatal Push) and card selection/draw spells (like Dig Through Time and Opt) to set up the combo efficiently while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The mana base includes both colored lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent mana access.

The main concept of this Dimir Inverter deck is to quickly and efficiently manipulate your library and graveyard to win the game with either Jace, Wielder of Mysteries or Thassa's Oracle. This combo relies on using Inverter of Truth to invert your library, then win by drawing a card with an empty deck. The deck contains a mix of control spells, card draw, and removal to help protect the combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's game plan. Overall, the key strategy is to set up your win condition while disrupting your opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing the powerful combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by deck manipulation. By utilizing cards like Jace, Wielder of Mysteries and Dig Through Time, the deck can consistently find the pieces needed to assemble the combo. Thoughtseize and Thought Erasure help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch provide removal options. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy until it can assemble and execute the combo for victory.

This deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures onto the battlefield and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive attacks. By utilizing mana-producing creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, along with efficient threats like Steel Leaf Champion and Ghalta, Primal Hunger, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and finish the game quickly. The inclusion of supportive cards like The Great Henge and Heart of Kiran provide additional value and resilience to help maintain the aggression. Overall, this Golgari Aggro deck is designed to win through fast and relentless beatdowns.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Brazen Borrower, and Flamewake Phoenix to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck includes disruptive cards like Elder Deep-Fiend and Kozilek's Return to control the board while maintaining tempo. Rekindling Phoenix provides resilience, making it difficult for opponents to deal with threats efficiently. The deck also includes card draw spells like Chart a Course to ensure consistent resources. Overall, the strategy of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and maintain pressure on the opponent to secure victory.

The main focus of this Artifacts Aggro deck is to flood the board with artifact creatures and equipment to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to utilize cards like Ensoul Artifact and Skilled Animator to turn cheap artifacts into powerful threats, while using burn spells like Lightning Strike and Wild Slash to control the opponent's board and reach the opponent's life total quickly. Additional cards like Shadowspear and Ghostfire Blade provide utility and additional power to the creatures. The deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and hard to deal with for the opponent.

This deck revolves around the use of Jeskai Ascendancy as its central mechanic. The goal is to generate a large number of spells and triggers in order to gain a significant advantage over the opponent. The deck includes cards like Saheeli, Sublime Artificer and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to generate additional artifacts and spells. It also utilizes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Metallic Rebuke for control and disruption. The deck includes various artifacts and enchantments to generate additional triggers from Jeskai Ascendancy, while also utilizing cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Retraction Helix for added synergy.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Lotus Field and various combo pieces to generate a large amount of mana quickly and efficiently. By leveraging cards like Hidden Strings, Pore Over the Pages, and Underworld Breach, the deck aims to dig through the library, find key cards like Thassa's Oracle, and win the game in a single explosive turn. Arboreal Grazer and Sylvan Scrying help ramp up to Lotus Field, while Fae of Wishes provides additional utility in fetching key sideboard cards. The deck is focused on assembling its combo pieces and executing a game-winning sequence.

This combo deck revolves around utilizing Lotus Field to generate massive amounts of mana quickly. By combining cards like Arboreal Grazer, Vizier of Tumbling Sands, and Hidden Strings, the deck aims to untap Lotus Field multiple times in a single turn and generate a large mana advantage. Fae of Wishes allows the deck to search for key spells from the sideboard, while cards like Pore Over the Pages and Strategic Planning help to filter through the deck to find the necessary combo pieces. Underworld Breach serves as a backup plan to recycle key cards from the graveyard for additional combos.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on early game aggression and constant pressure on the opponent. The deck includes creatures with recursion abilities like Bloodsoaked Champion and Gutterbones, along with powerful threats like Spawn of Mayhem and Knight of the Ebon Legion. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push to maintain board control. With the ability to quickly empty the opponent's hand and disrupt their game plan, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through aggressive plays and efficient creature recursion.

The focus of this deck is to flood the board with small, aggressive white creatures and utilize cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Mastery of the Unseen to generate value and maintain board presence. Gideon Blackblade and Gideon of the Trials provide additional threats and disruption. Knight of the White Orchid helps ramp up mana production, while Walking Ballista offers a versatile removal option. Daxos, Blessed by the Sun provides lifegain and extra value. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a swarm of weenies and powerful enchantments.

This control deck aims to utilize a diverse array of powerful cards to control the board and outvalue the opponent. By running a variety of multicolor spells, the deck can take full advantage of Bring to Light to search for answers and threats as needed. Niv-Mizzet Reborn serves as a powerful card advantage engine, while Teferi, Time Raveler provides disruption and protection. The deck also includes removal spells and versatile creatures to deal with various threats, creating a flexible and resilient game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and efficient burn spells. The deck aims to win the game by dealing damage as quickly as possible, utilizing cards like Bonecrusher Giant, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Monastery Swiftspear to apply pressure early on. Additionally, cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Hazoret the Fervent provide late-game reach and potential board advantage. The deck's mana base is streamlined to maximize consistency and minimize potential mana flood.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Satyr Wayfinder to eventually play powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Emrakul, the Promised End. It also utilizes cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald and Vessel of Nascency to search for key cards and maintain card advantage. With a mix of control elements and powerful creatures, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with its late-game threats.

The deck focuses on ramping up to powerful late-game threats such as Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Emrakul, the Promised End while controlling the board with cards like Commit / Memory and World Breaker. The goal is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Satyr Wayfinder and Traverse the Ulvenwald, allowing for easy access to powerful creatures and spells. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent by leveraging its card advantage and strong late-game threats.

The main idea of the deck is to ramp up mana as quickly as possible using green cards like Arboreal Grazer, Elvish Mystic, and Nissa's Pilgrimage. This allows for powerful late game threats such as Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to be played earlier than usual. Control elements like Perilous Vault and World Breaker are included to deal with opponent threats, while cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provide additional card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and spells while maintaining control of the game.
